answers.answer: i'd be bummed too! I just wanted to let you know not to worry too much about the baby measuring behind. My friend went through hel l because she was told that her baby measured wrong.  She was actually told that the baby is a dwarf! Turned out the baby was perfectly fine- she's just going to be petitite.
in vitro babies tend to measure behind is what my peri told me...you may want to see if this hold any water. Keep thinkin positive, hon.

Don't worry too much (easy to say, I know).. It is not unusual for measurements to be off a week or so, particularly if baby was curled up, maybe the measurements were not as accurate as could be.Look on the bright side.. at least you get another ultrasound!
I did IVF and my baby is measuring 1 week ahead so I don't think IVF makes small babies.

i really wouldn't worry...my babies measuring 2 weeks ahead ( i know, because the only time i could have conceived is 14th november ). it's my 4th baby and my scans have NEVER been spot on. the hospital are having to go on my lmp for dating purposes.

Don't worry...  I agree with the posts above -- since the baby was all curled up I bet it was hard to get an accurate reading.  Did they doppler the heartbeat?  I'm sure all is fine with your little dear.

Why do they tell you stuff like that. Ugh makes me so mad! With my son they said he was weeks ahead and then two months later he was weeks behind. In the end he was a 6 pound healthy baby so why put us through all that stress.I wouldn't worry about it. If the baby was all balled up then how could they really get an accurate reading.

Well they were able to get many of the measurements they needed.  I think the fact that the baby was able to get  the BPD and femur measurement.  They moved me around a lot and got it from different angles.  I don't know how many measurements they take to determine what they need to know.   I think the fact that the baby was curled up affected more so the ability to determine gender than anything else.   It will be interesting to know when I go back in a couple of weeks if there is still a problem.Yes they checked the heartbeat and it was weird as per the U/S it was about 156 bpm and on the doppler the MA measured 165.  I had my office visit first when it was 165, maybe the baby was awake then and sleeping by the time they did the u/s...I dunno.My biggest concer is I have gestational diabetes and they haven't diagnosed it yet and of course that this could lead to intrauterine fetal demise.     I just wish everything would go smoothly.

Well they were able to get many of the measurements they needed.  I think the fact that the baby was able to get  the BPD and femur measurement.  They moved me around a lot and got it from different angles.  I don't know how many measurements they take to determine what they need to know.   I think the fact that the baby was curled up affected more so the ability to determine gender than anything else.   It will be interesting to know when I go back in a couple of weeks if there is still a problem.Yes they checked the heartbeat and it was weird as per the U/S it was about 156 bpm and on the doppler the MA measured 165.  I had my office visit first when it was 165, maybe the baby was awake then and sleeping by the time they did the u/s...I dunno.My biggest concer is I have gestational diabetes and they haven't diagnosed it yet and of course that this could lead to intrauterine fetal demise.     I just wish everything would go smoothly.

I thought after reading your post that maybe baby just looked 2 weeks behind because they werent able to measure correctly?? I bet when you get your next U/S done, baby will behave a little better, lol. Mine was sitting on her feet today but they finallly got her to move and got her little girl parts again to confirm the last U/S . I hope these next 2 weeks fly by for you so you can find out weather its a girl or a boy:)
i'm not sure if that was the case or not....the baby's position may have been an issue, but I'm not 100% sure.

question: They are telling me that the baby is two weeks behind.  Great!! They said baby measured fine at NT scan about a month ago!  So what happened?  Geez!! Unbelievable!!   To make matter worse the baby was in a curled ball position and refuse to move other than a little hand or foot movement, so they couldn't really get all the measurements or the gender!  I'm bummed!  I have to go back in two weeks.  This really really *****!
title: Level II ultrasound results did not go the way I expected!
